alert.note: Alert for Kings (Brooklyn) (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 15 at 4:19PM EDT until September 17 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT SATURDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 8 feet into Saturday morning in the surf zone, then gradually subsiding through the weekend. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. For the Coastal Flood Statement, a reasonable worst case of up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Kings (Brooklyn) County. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM EDT Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Saturday evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from Friday evening through late Saturday night. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. * SWIMMING IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions Tonight through Saturday. Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Scattered areas of dune erosion are likely through Saturday. * FORECAST CHALLENGES...There is still uncertainty in the timing of peak surge relative to the times of high tide Tonight into Saturday, the magnitude of wave setup effects over several tidal cycles, and the fact that Lee is expected to transition to an extra- tropical storm. For this reason, this coastal flood forecast represents a reasonable worst case forecast, to include a safety margin for preparation. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NEW YORK HARBOR AT THE BATTERY NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.0 FT, MODERATE 8.3 FT, MAJOR 9.4 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.9 FT, MODERATE 3.2 FT, MAJOR 4.3 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/09 PM 6.8/ 7.3 1.7/ 2.2 1.8/ 2.2 1 MINOR 16/09 AM 6.8/ 7.3 1.7/ 2.2 2.0/ 2.5 1 MINOR 16/10 PM 5.2/ 5.7 0.1/ 0.6 0.2/ 0.8 1 NONE 17/10 AM 5.4/ 5.9 0.2/ 0.8 0.4/ 0.9 0 NONE ROCKAWAY INLET NY NEAR FLOYD BENNETT FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.6 FT, MODERATE 8.6 FT, MAJOR 9.6 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.0 FT, MODERATE 3.0 FT, MAJOR 4.0 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/08 PM 7.1/ 7.6 1.5/ 2.0 1.8/ 2.2 3-4 NONE 16/09 AM 7.2/ 7.7 1.6/ 2.0 1.7/ 2.2 4 NONE 16/09 PM 5.7/ 6.2 0.1/ 0.6 0.4/ 0.9 4 NONE 17/09 AM 5.7/ 6.2 0.2/ 0.7 0.5/ 1.0 2-3 NONE JAMAICA BAY AT INWOOD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.8 FT, MODERATE 8.5 FT, MAJOR 9.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.6 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 3.1 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 15/10 PM 7.7/ 8.2 1.5/ 2.0 1.7/ 2.2 0 MINOR 16/10 AM 7.7/ 8.2 1.5/ 2.0 1.7/ 2.2 0 MINOR 16/09 PM 6.2/ 6.8 0.1/ 0.6 0.8/ 1.3 0 NONE 17/09 AM 6.2/ 6.8 0.1/ 0.6 1.0/ 1.5 0 NONE &&
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.
